help.name: The name to use for the new Tailscale machine. If left blank, the container name is used.
help.port: The port on the container to proxy. Leave at default (0) to autodetect the correct port. This is usually only needed when a container publishes multiple ports.
help.ephemeral: Make the Tailscale node ephemeral. Should usually be false, only change if you know what you are doing.
help.funnel: Allow connections from the internet to the published service.
help.scheme: Switch to HTTPS for containers that publish HTTPS endpoints instead of HTTP.
help.tls_validate: Validate TLS certificate. Only applicable when scheme is set to HTTPS.

help.name_ip: Overrides upstream app address. Can be set to an IP or a DNS hostname. Defaults to container name.
help.port: Overrides internal exposed port (by default, auto-proxy will use first detected exposed port)
help.authentication: Enables auth methods (options are Authelia, LDAP and HTTP for basic HTTP authentication)
